OilGas.heroSubtitle: Implementation of global best practices in Kazakhstan's oil & gas industry using PSO methodology and digital tools

s1.title: Data processing to identify 'bottlenecks' and develop optimization measures using PSO (Production System Optimization) methodology
s1.li1: The project includes analysis of data related to field infrastructure, control and automation systems (instrumentation, SCADA, production management systems), as well as geological and well data.
s1.li2: The integrated approach will identify bottlenecks in the production system, develop new optimization methods and select the best scenario for further field development.

s2.title: Data processing for developing a conceptual field design project
s2.li1: Conceptual development plan for hydrocarbon resources of the field considering optimization of capital and operational costs, allowing geological and operational uncertainties to be accounted for to achieve maximum profit.

s3.title: Digital integrated modeling of reservoirs, wells and infrastructure facilities
s3.li1: Creation of digital twins of fields and services for separate and integrated modeling within the IFRM strategy for predictive analysis and optimization of your assets.
s3.li2: The project is aimed at creating a digital integrated model combining reservoir, well and infrastructure into a single system for comprehensive production management. Such a model allows real-time tracking of interconnected changes, identifying inefficient elements and providing recommendations for process optimization and loss reduction.

s4.title: Automation and digitalization of field infrastructure
s4.li1: Development of integrated SCADA systems for automation and digitalization of field infrastructure, ensuring centralized management of all technological processes in real time.

s5.title: Research and development work of various complexity levels jointly with leading scientific institutes in the following industry areas (but not limited to):
s5.li1: Development and improvement of waterflooding and EOR methods (polymers, etc.)
s5.li2: Development of chemical methods to increase oil recovery (polymer, surfactant flooding, etc.)
s5.li3: Research and/or development of new methods for optimizing field development
s5.li6: Development of aqueous surfactant solution formulation for waterflooding of late-stage exploitation fields

s1.title: Analysis and optimization of ore mining and processing chain
s1.li1: The project is aimed at conducting comprehensive diagnostics of the production chain using modern analytical tools — Big Data, modeling and geoinformation systems.
s1.li2: This approach allows identifying and eliminating 'bottlenecks' in production and business processes.

s2.title: Development and implementation of technical monitoring systems for open pits and mines
s2.li1: The project is aimed at implementing modern technical monitoring systems for comprehensive control of equipment and geomechanical parameters. s2.imgAlt: Development and implementation of technical monitoring systems for open pits and mines

s3.title: Development and implementation of automated concentrate accounting system

s3.imgAlt: Development and implementation of automated concentrate accounting system

s4.title: Geotechnical audit at any development stages

s5.title: Geotechnical analysis of open pit with development of recommendations and priority measures aimed at ensuring pit wall stability and mining efficiency
s5.li1: The project is aimed at conducting detailed geotechnical studies and modeling to analyze rock properties and their bedding conditions. Its goal is to identify potential risk zones, develop recommendations and measures to ensure wall stability and improve safety and mining efficiency.
s5.imgAlt: Geotechnical analysis of open pit with development of recommendations and priority measures aimed at ensuring pit wall stability and mining efficiency

s6.title: Development of customized digital solutions according to Client needs
s6.p1: Design and development of turnkey software solutions, including but not limited to:

s6.li2: Configuration of analytical tools and monitoring dashboards

PSO.heroSubtitle: Methodology for optimizing oil and gas production systems.

about.title: PSO – Production System Optimization
about.p1: The Production System Optimization (PSO) methodology is a practical approach to optimizing oil and gas production systems, outlined in the eponymous book by Borney Waring (Shell).
about.quote: "Production system optimization is a purposeful process of improving the efficiency of an operating field development system through implementation of managerial and technological solutions ensuring value growth in the short and medium term."
about.p2: To date, using this approach, 17 fields have been successfully optimized, providing over $1.1 billion USD in additional profit.
about.p3: Our strategic goal is to facilitate the dissemination and application of PSO in the oil and gas industry of the Republic of Kazakhstan.
about.p4: One of the key directions is the introduction and teaching of the discipline 'Production System Optimization' within KBTU programs with emphasis on practical knowledge and international experience.

s1.title: Data Collection
s1.b2: Collection of data from production assets in the required volume and quality, ensuring informed decision-making on production process optimization

s2.title: Inspection and Analysis
s2.b1: Data without theory is driving without a map, theory without data is driving blind.
s2.b2: Inspection and analysis of data using analytical tools to identify anomalies and 'bottlenecks' in the production system and their subsequent transformation into growth points and optimization opportunities. When implementing 'continuous PSO', data analysis is performed on daily, monthly and annual cycles
